Mitigative Measures Implemented<s>1 </s>: - Soils were dry throughout the construction program and compaction was of limited concern. - The use of compaction alleviation measures (e.g., ripping, chisel plowing and paratilling) was limited at some locations due to concerns related to additional soil drying and pulverization. - Nevertheless, some residual compaction may remain at locations where compaction alleviation measures were not implemented. - Drought conditions prevented assessment during the 2002 post-construction monitoring program.
Proposed Post-Construction Measures: - Monitor crop response in 2003 and take penetrometer readings where warranted.  Take remedial measures (e.g., paratill) if severe compaction is evident.

Mitigative Measures Implemented<s>1 </s>: - Disturbed noncultivated portions of the route were reseeded.  Certificates of analysis of the seeds were reviewed and retained.   - Straw used in crimping operations was obtained from the landowner or approved by the landowner prior to use. - Weed control implemented, where warranted, by Enbridge.

- Leafy spurge present on construction right-of-way at the first two locations.  The plants, their root systems and the affected soil were excavated, loaded into trucks and transported to the Hardisty soil remediation site where oil contaminated soils are incinerated. - Plants were removed where found during the 2002 post-construction monitoring program.
Proposed Post-Construction Measures: - Monitor for leafy spurge infestations in 2003.

Mitigative Measures Implemented<s>1 </s>: - Topsoil from a 20 m x 30 m area infested with yellow toadflax was salvaged and stockpiled separately from adjacent topsoils.  During clean-up the topsoil was replaced over its preconstruction location.  Equipment involved in topsoil salvage and replacement activities were cleaned prior to proceeding down the right-of-way. - Large patch (1000’s of plants) found on and off of the right-of-way at this location during the 2002 post-construction monitoring program.

- Grading required at three-lift soils handling location; upper subsoils lift overlapped topsoil windrow. - Approval for variance from approved soils handling methods was obtained from the NEB. - No signs of adverse effects noted during the 2002 post-construction monitoring program.

Environmental Issues: a) Wind erosion on sandy soils, dry soils, pulverized soils and soils difficult to revegetate
Mitigative Measures Implemented<s>1 </s>: - Topsoil windrows were monitored for wind erosion.  Water was applied to the topsoil windrows. - Topsoil was stripped from the work side where shallow topsoils were present on cultivated or poorly sodded lands in order to minimize the risk of erosion and pulverization of dry soils. - Water was applied to the work side where topsoils were deep. - Appropriate seed mixes were sown on noncultivated portions.  Straw crimping was conducted on lands prone to erosion control including cultivated lands where the topsoil was pulverized. - Straw crimping was effective.  No evidence of wind erosion noted during the 2002 post-construction monitoring program.

Environmental Issues: b) Water erosion on moderately steep slopes
Location: Long moderately steep slopes KP 177.3 to KP 178.4
Mitigative Measures Implemented<s>1 </s>: - Straw crimping was implemented. - Straw crimping was effective.  No evidence of water erosion noted during the 2002 post-construction monitoring program.

Environmental Issues: a) Bank stability or erosion of approaches to the creek
Mitigative Measures Implemented<s>1 </s>: - Banks and approaches were seeded.  - Straw crimping was conducted, where warranted. - Good revegetation noted during the 2002 post-construction monitoring program.  No erosion was evident.

- Gaps were left in the topsoil pile at natural drainage ways during topsoil salvage operations. - The right-of-way was recontoured to the preconstruction profile and an appropriate trench crown was provided. - No drainage problems were noted during the 2002 post-construction monitoring program.

- In order to protect sand millet, the work side was narrowed by ~5 m, no grading was allowed and a blade width of sod was salvaged and placed on straw matting.  The sod was then replaced and straw from the matting was then spread over the replaced sod.  Low milkweed at KP 177.7 were transplanted prior to commencement of construction. - No sand millet was located during the 2002 post-construction monitoring program.  Sod pieces were not rooted well.
Proposed Post-Construction Measures: - Monitor the success of the sand millet and low milkweed reestablishment in 2003.

Mitigative Measures Implemented<s>1 </s>: - A tree spade was used to transplant four burr oaks to north side of the right-of-way and a fifth was transplanted by hand.  No brushing was allowed within 50 m until the transplanting was completed. - 3 of the transplanted saplings were located during the 2002 post-construction monitoring program and an additional 3 saplings were found growing naturally.

- The work side was narrowed by ~10 m, brush was hand cleared, straw was spread on the brushed area prior to the installation of a ramp and sod containing large Canada St. John’s wort was salvaged from the trench area and placed on a straw matting.  The ramp was then removed and the sod replaced.  Seed was collected from off right-of-way areas and saved for planting in 2002. - 22 sites each with 5-10 plants were found in depressions along the right-of-way during the 2002 post-construction monitoring program.

- The work side was narrowed by ~10 m, no grading was allowed and swamp mats were placed on the work side in order to protect little bluestem.  Sod salvage was not feasible due to hummocky terrain.  Straw was spread on the spoil side prior to trenching to avoid scalping of the sod layer during backfill. - Conditions were very dry, but hummocky community appears to have retained its diversity.  No plants were found during the 2002 post-construction monitoring program.
Proposed Post-Construction Measures: - Monitor the success of the mitigation in 2003.

Mitigative Measures Implemented<s>1 </s>: - A backhoe was used to transplant sod in a 1 m radius of a Louisiana broom-rape site. - No rare plants were found during the 2002 post-construction monitoring program.
Proposed Post-Construction Measures: - Monitor the success of the sod salvage in 2003.

Mitigative Measures Implemented<s>1 </s>: - Stripping depth and width were minimized; and no grading was allowed in order to minimize impacts on awned or mountain mousetail and least mousetail. - Very dry conditions.  No rare plants were found during the 2002 post-construction monitoring program.
Proposed Post-Construction Measures: - Monitor the success of restoration from the seed bank in 2003.

Mitigative Measures Implemented<s>1 </s>: - Stripping depth and width were minimized; and no grading was allowed in order to minimize impacts on narrow-leaved plantain and few-flowered aster. - One dead narrow-leaved plantain was found in fruit, but no few-flowered aster were found during the 2002 post-construction monitoring program.
Proposed Post-Construction Measures: - Monitor the success of restoration from the seed bank in 2003.

Mitigative Measures Implemented<s>1 </s>: - Stripping depth and width were minimized; and no grading was allowed to minimize impacts on narrow-leaved plantain, awned or mountain mousetail, or least mousetail. - Very dry conditions.  No rare plants located during the 2002 post-construction monitoring program.
Proposed Post-Construction Measures: - Monitor the success of restoration from the seed bank in 2003.

Mitigative Measures Implemented<s>1 </s>: - Upper leaf litter and duff/soil (1 cm) were salvaged separately from lower topsoil to preserve seed bank containing awned or mountain mousetail, least mousetail and narrow-leaved plantain. - Very dry conditions.  No rare plants located during the 2002 post-construction monitoring program.
Proposed Post-Construction Measures: - Monitor the success of restoration from the seed bank in 2003.

Mitigative Measures Implemented<s>1 </s>: - In order to minimize impacts on heart-leaved buttercup, equipment travel was minimized, no grading was approved without the approval of the Environmental Inspector and a blade width of sod was salvaged from the trench area, stored on a straw map and then replaced. - Very dry conditions.  No rare plants located during the 2002 post-construction monitoring program.
Proposed Post-Construction Measures: - Monitor the success of the sod salvage in 2003.
